message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.CL. 

The paper focuses on video understanding and action recognition, which are core topics in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed Adversarial Pyramid Network (APN) is a deep learning model that captures local-relation, global-relation, and multilayer cross-relation features, which are key concepts in representation learning (cs.LG). The paper also introduces a new research problem of video domain generalization, which is related to domain adaptation and transfer learning (cs.MM). The APN is designed to address the challenge of video domain generalization by learning more generalizable features, which is a common goal in machine learning (cs.AI). Finally, the paper constructs four video DG benchmarks and evaluates the performance of the proposed method, which involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques for action labeling and classification (cs.CL).
